means: 隐蔽的，不公开的，秘密的

sentence.Network_en: They have been supplying covert military aid to the rebels.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们一直在暗地里向叛乱者提供军事支援。

sentence.Network_en: The depth of covert racism in my own profession frightens me.
sentence.Network_cn: 我所从事的职业中暗藏着如此深的种族主义偏见，这让我感到害怕。

sentence.Network_en: The army carried out covert surveillance of the building for several months.
sentence.Network_cn: 军队对这座建筑物进行了数月的秘密监视.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the general senses 'covered' and 'a cover'): from Old French, covered', past participle of covrir (see cover)

entry.def: Covert activities or situations are secret or hidden.

example.ex: They have been supplying covert military aid to the rebels...
example.tran: 他们一直在暗地里向叛乱者提供军事支援。

example.ex: The depth of covert racism in my own profession frightens me.
example.tran: 我所从事的职业中暗藏着如此深的种族主义偏见，这让我感到害怕。

entry.tran: (小动物或猎禽可藏身的)矮树丛，灌木丛
entry.def: A covert is a group of small trees or bushes very close to each other where small animals or game birds can hide.

means.word_mean: 2. a covering that serves to conceal or shelter something;
1. secret or hidden; not openly practiced or engaged in or shown or avowed;
2. of a wife; under the protection of her husband

sentences.en: We should learn to fight with enemy in an overt and covert way.
